title: Thunderbird/Ubuntu stops receiving emails from pop yahoo
content:
Hi, 

  Thunderbird on Ubuntu for many years. Started from Ubuntu 20 or so it periodically stops receiving mails from pop yahoo account. Nothing described in community threads helps. It can be for month, two or three, then at some moment it starts receiving emails(nothing changed, even server not restarted, thunderbird keeps hanging not receiving emaiils) and receives for some period(can be couple of days or few weeks). after that it can stop receiving again and it hangs for long.  This situation is for few years for now. last time it stopped receiving emails in mid of December. before this it was working fine for couple of months.   As nothing changes on my side I assume issue is on yahoo?

current release: Ubuntu 24.04.1 LTS 128.6.0esr (64-bit) 

 When not receiving emails I can see following in error log:

op3.server2.1: NetworkTimeoutError: a Network error occurred Pop3Client.sys.mjs:380:18 

   _onError resource:///modules/Pop3Client.sys.mjs:380

pop3.server2.1: SecurityError info: Pop3Client.sys.mjs:422:20 

   _onError resource:///modules/Pop3Client.sys.mjs:422

​

title: yahoo calendar won't stay enabled
content:
I have email through AT&T, hosted by Yahoo, and have synched my calendar for years. It has now stopped enabling and updating. In calendar screen, grey ENABLE button now shows. Click it and I see a quick flash of items and instantly disappear. Nothing happens.

Select properties and the enable box is not checked. I can check it, click OK and again it won't enable. On my to do lists for this account, same issue. Click enable, it flashes the items and then they disappear. Won't stay enabled.

Contacts still sync so appears to be a caldav issue.

Was working fine, but stopped a few weeks ago. I can't find a solution. Help please.

creator: rjr11

title: Disappering emails after importing a new address book from another computer, identical Thunderbird installation, that was running simultaneously.
content:
I recently got a new iMac computer for my wife and set up Thunderbird on it. Her previous computer had a linux OS. The problem was that we just discovered recently that she did not have all of the email addresses in her address book. So, I endeavored to correct that. I found instructions on the web that told me to copy the abook.map file from her old computer and paste it into the profile folder of her new computer and then start up Thunderbird on the new Mac computer and import an address book, that is the one I just pasted into the profile folder. I did this and the emails addresses in the new address book were there and good. Meanwhile, I was running Thunderbird on the old linux computer at the same time and I noticed at the bottom of the window some small numbers that looked like they were reporting on the number of messages being downloaded. I was puzzled about this. The old computer's Thunderbird did not show any new emails in the normal window. When I went back to the new iMac computer and opened Thunderbird there were no emails in the inbox! Surprise! What happened to our emails? I don't know how Thunderbird works regarding syncing two identical installations of Thunderbird but it occurred to me that this might have caused this problem. Any ideas? Thanks,

Jakan
creator: jakan

A number of times during the day, when I'm on my email account a window interrupts me to verify my account ( photo attached) After I follow all prompts repeatedly over many times a strange series of slashes cross the top of my window and it asks me if I want to go back to my previous last email. Receiving the above message when trying to get emails. Am able to receive emails on cell phone which is not with Thunderbird email. Made no changes to Thunderbird. Started about 2 days ago. Spoke with our email provider and they say it is specific to our Thunderbird email.

creator: woodmontclub

title: "unexpected configuration problem" with printer
content:
My wife's computer has problems printing from Thunderbird. Trying to print produces a message that says, "Your printer has experienced an unexpected configuration problem. 0x800706ba".

I thought the problem was related to her old printer, a Brother black-and-white laser printer, so I bought a new Epson ET-2800 series color printer, but the same message appears.

I have found a workaround. If I go to Settings in Thunderbird, clear the cache, and restart the computer, it will print on the next try, but later the same error message will appear on attempts to print. I have selected the "Clear cache at shutdown" option in Settings, but that doesn't help. The cache still has to be cleared manually.

I can print a test page with no problem, and I can print from other applications, so I assume that the difficulty is related to something in Thunderbird.

I might add that I use Thunderbird on my computer. Fortunately that problem has not arisen on it.

Suggestions for solving this problem will be appreciated.

Eddie Blick
creator: eddieblick

title: My passwords are not being recognized and I can not send emails or receive emails because of the password issue, what do I do?

creator: lisamayea

title: Fix for folders to INBOX showing, but messages lacking, though folders and messages are on server, using IMAP with Thunderbird 78.14.0.
content: I changed from POP3 to IMAP and when I reconfigured TB 78.14.0 all seemed good until I tried to call up messages in subfolders of the INBOX. The folders and content are still on the server and it seemed impossible to subscribe to the INBOX in TB. The INBOX itself still functions with new mail and older content showing. The locations of the subfolders had an IMAP mention in the directories that was additional/instead of simply ....'mail.xxxx.xx' but changing to IMAP instead of 'Mail' in the server settings was futile. A deep dive into mozilla resources led to mention of leaving empty the IMAP server directory field (Server Settings>Advanced), and putting "INBOX." (with the following period critical, but quotes not) in the personal namespace field. See: https://kb.mozillazine.org/IMAP:_advanced_account_configuration This worked! However under 'personal namespace' it reverted to double quotation marks ("").

title: Thunderbird BETA not removing files from UNIFIED Inbox when moved to Folder - sometimes
content:
Like the title says, I am getting some emails that move from Unified Inbox to an IMAP subfolder of account X, but remain visible in the UNIFIED Inbox.

First uploaded image shows 3 IMAP accounts as they appear in Thunderbird, second uploaded image shows how subfolders appear in IMAP account X (the third account in Thunderbird).

Mail is properly arriving in the 3rd account and shows up in both IMAP and Unified Inboxes, but only sometimes (and not with specific senders) can be moved into the 3rd account subfolder.

They are correctly removed from the IMAP Inbox but remain visible in the UNIFIED inbox and are found when I search in the UNIFIED inbox but not in the IMAP Inbox.

The messages persist in the UNIFIED Inbox through multiple restarts of Thunderbird and my PC, and some email continues to arrive in the 3rd account and cam be moved as expected, then another arrives that cannot be removed.

Strangely, if I delete the mail from the UNIFIED inbox, it is deleted both there and in the subfolder, so it appears something is making the display of the UNIFIED inbox keep a link to the new location of the email.

Bleah!

Any body see anything similar? I read several older threads about move problems, but this seems different.

Thanks!



Thunderbird BETA 135.0b1 (64-bit) Probably not very interesting but: Windows 11 Home; 23H2; OS build 22631.4751; Windows Feature Experience Pack 1000.22700.1055.0 11th Gen Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-1195G7 @ 2.90GHz 2.92 16.0 GB (15.7 GB usable) 64-bit operating system, x64-based processor

title: "Rispondi a tutti" con CCN
content:
Ciao a tutti Uso 128.6.0esr (64 bit) su win11 24H2

Sono all'interno di un gruppo google "gruppoprova@miodominio.it" per cui mi arrivano le mail che vengono spedite a quel gruppo.

Mi arrivano mail da un mittente (esterno) che mette in A: il gruppo "gruppoprova@miodominio.it" di cui faccio parte. TB mi da la possibilità di rispondere solo al mittente (Rispondi), solo alla lista che poi è il gruppo (Rispondi alla lista) oppure il classico "Rispondi a tutti"

Problema Rispondi: mette il gruppo in A: e non utilizza l'account che ha ricevuto la mail; quindi non è un comportamento corretto. Rispondi alla lista: come sopra; quindi non è un comportamento corretto. Rispondi a tutti: come sopra; quindi non è un comportamento corretto.

C'è qualcosa che mi sfugge? E' molto importante che funzioni a dovere. Attendo un vostro aiuto.
creator: inteso

title: how the heck can I re-order my accounts when sending an e-mail?

Do I need to set up a completely different profile for TB and only launch into that when I am going to send from the lesser-used account? What the heck do I have to do?

- ray

title: Thunderbird Messages Disappearing
content: I am experiencing a symptom sometimes when I delete a message in the Thunderbord email client (in any folder), all messages disappearing from all accounts in the entire Thunderbird including Inbox, Drafts, Trash, Sent and everything else. All folders become empty. The messages are not deleted, just not showing. Using the Trash icon of Thunderbird or pressing the delete key are the same. There is no way to display the messages again except to close and re-open Thunderbird. After that, everything return to normal. This does not always happen, about 75% of time. Thunderbird version is 128.6.0esr (64-bit), Windows 11 but the same also happened on previous versions and Windows 10.

title: Need items in toolbars->customize to "mark as read" and "mark as unread"
content:
The older version of Thunderbird had a nice option to mark as unread which you could easily click on. Now you have to go into the "mark" menu and click on mark as unread. There's the letter M which would work, BUT if you are a right handed user using a mouse, that doesn't work because you have to keep moving your right hand off of the mouse to hit M. Every time I used Thunderbird this ticks me off.

I'm requesting that add 2 options to view->toolbars->customize "mark as read" and "mark as unread". Also, it would be good if you picked a shortcut letter, instead of M, that could easily be hit with your LEFT hand while keeping your right hand on the mouse. Something on the left hand home row would be very good.
creator: kungfu1

title: No email access
content:
Cannot access email.

Went to email provider website and all emails are there.

Reset password and tried to update Thunderbird. No success.

Also email from another different account ( IMAP) is painfully slow. Thunderbird says it is fully updated. Thunderbird often goes into not responding spinning wheel.

server is mail.(server).com pop puts it at 995 port, email carrier (Spectrum) says should be SSL on but choices are only TLS/SSL or STARTTLS what to use, also should password be used.

title: Moving Thunderbird profile from Win 10 to Linux Mint22
content:
Hello, to whom may help. I used multiple methods to "move" a 3GB Profile folder from the latest version of Thunderbird on Win10 to the same version of TB on Linux Mint.

I have 1 active (used daily) account and 2 inactive accounts with emails and other account data downloaded for offline viewing. All emails and child folders for ALL 3 accounts are visible and accessible in TB on Win10.

After moving the profile folder (i tried C&P, Import/Export add-on tool, and Profile Manager, etc.) all methods work fine. I can see all child folders under each of the 3 accounts until... I close TB on Linux Mint 22.

When I close and reopen it, the 2 inactive accounts only show the Inbox folder with NO emails inside, but everything is fine with the 3rd active account. All emails and child folders are the same as in TB on Win10. I have no idea WHY and worst of all, how can I solve this problem? Thanks in advance for any suggestions that will help solve this problem. W
creator: siekierkawojtek20
